commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So, does anybody have anything else to add?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It looks like we've covered everything, so I'll call an end to our regular meeting today.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Good work, everyone! Things are really starting to look up now!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: That's true, but we've got a long way to go. There's still a pile of problems we need to address.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: But we're still making real progress! I'm sure we'll be fine!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: That's right. We're all going full speed ahead! Aye aye!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah! We can do anything if we all work together! Scoring a 60 on our exams should be a walk in the park!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: *Sigh* It's not a walk in the park.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I feel like I've been dragged right back into reality.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Does it have to be a score of 60? Couldn't she just let us get away with a passing grade?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Complaining won't get you anywhere. If this is what it takes to make the next step, you simply have to do it!

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Right then, time to split up into subjects to start our study session. Everyone, split up!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Over here for the Japanese group. Those of you who are good at Japanese, please gather here.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Okay! Ruby, you should come on over here too, zura.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: S-Sure.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: We three will be teaching here.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Rina and I will be the students here. Here's to a good study session.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Thanks.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Okay, let's get started. Kanji can be memorized on your own time, so why don't we focus on reading comprehension?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yeah, I'm not very good with longer written pieces.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Same here.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Don't the two of you read books, zura?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Um, it takes me a while to read books written in Japanese, so not really.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I like manga if that counts.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Hmm, that's a real shame. There are so many interesting books out there, zura.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: You sure do love your books, Hanamaru.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Books aren't only for expanding your knowledge, but also for enriching your mind, zura! I'd like you to expose yourself to as many different works as possible, zura.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: *Chuckle* I agree with Hanamaru. Hmm, let's see... How about we start with this question?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: "Read this passage and explain what the writer is trying to tell us..." Oh geez, I'm kinda bad at questions like this.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I know. Rina-chan Board says, "Ding-ding!"

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Yes, Rina? What's your answer?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: They're saying, "I can't take this anymore. I'm not gonna make the deadline."

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Wha? There's nothing like that here at all!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I heard the writer's true voice.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: And that's what you heard...?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Settle down, Rina. The answer can be found hidden in the text. Why don't you try giving it another thorough reading?

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I got it! It's, "I want to finish this up quickly and get something good to eat!"

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: They may have thought that at some point, zura.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I know, right?! Yay! I got it right!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: N-No! That's not what they mean when they ask you what the writer's trying to tell us!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: The answer is that the world is uncertain, zura.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Where does it say that?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Have a look, it's written right here in the last line.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: The answer was hidden in a place like that?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: That's cheating. The person who wrote this question is a meanie.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: It's not cheating, and the question's not mean either!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Well, let's move on to the next question. "Select the words within the text that most accurately express Yukiko's feelings towards Miyuki."

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I've definitely got the right answer this time.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: What's your answer, zura?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Yukiko should live her life with a more positive outlook.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Yes, exactly. I think so too.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Th-That's just how you feel and not the actual answer.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Another trick question! I'll never trust again.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Don't lose faith in people that easily, zura.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Oww... Japanese really is tough, huh?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Let's continue studying. We instructors will not give up the fight! We will make sure you understand that the answer can be found within the text!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Let's do whatever it takes, Hanamaru, Ruby!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru, Ruby
commands.line: Right!
